{{infobox character | people=[[Hobbits|Hobbit]] | name=Gormadoc Brandybuck | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames="Deepdelver" | titles=[[Master of Buckland]] | position= | location=[[Brandy Hall]], [[Buckland]] | affiliation= | language= | birth={{SR|1134}} | birthlocation= | rule=until {{SR|1236}} | death={{SR|1236}} | deathlocation= | age=102 | notablefor= | family=[[Brandybuck Family|Brandybuck]] | parentage= | siblings= | spouse=[[Malva Headstrong]] | children=[[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]], [[Sadoc Brandybuck|Sadoc]] and [[Marroc Brandybuck|Marroc]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Gormadoc "Deepdelver" Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]]. ==History== Gormadoc was named Deepdelver in his lifetime. He married [[Malva Headstrong]], and had three children: [[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]], [[Sadoc Brandybuck|Sadoc]] and [[Marroc Brandybuck|Marroc]].{{App|Brandybuck}} It is possible that during his office he enlarged [[Brandy Hall]].[[Robert Foster]], ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'', p. 172 ==Etymology== The meaning of the name ''Gormadoc'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135 [[Jim Allan]] suggests that it contains the element ''gor'', which means "over" in [[Welsh]] as a prefix to [[Madoc Brandybuck|Madoc]],{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 202 the first name of Gormadoc Brandybuck's son. {{references}} {{seq-start}} {{seq-head | race=hobbit | house=[[Brandybuck Family]] | born={{SR|1134}} | died={{SR|1236}} }} {{seq | pvac=Unknown | prev=Last known:
